node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Sam’s Sprouts on December 04, 2020. Image may contain: 2 people, outdoor.

node.text: We took a lot of photos this season as a way to document the process of our small scale farm and It’s kinda cool to now look back on all the photos from this season and see the progression of #IndigenousFarms 📷 Every Friday for the remainder of the year, we will share an old photo from 2020 and reminisce about this crazy season. This photo was taken in June when we finally starting seeing our salad mix beds coming to life. We were late to the game planting salad greens this season but once established, this crop soon become one of our most popular items at the #FarmerMarket 🥬 🙋🏽‍♂️🙋‍♀️ We have since built a #greenhouse where those beds were but have opened up other areas of our yard for growing salad greens in 2021. #FlashBackFriday 🗓

node.text:
Broadbeans are such a great crop. Even if you don't like eating the beans you can eat the flowers in salads, and the plants are an excellent nitrogen fixer and green manure. 
These are the last of our crop which we're drying ready for storage for planting next season. I'll also keep some of the better looking ones as dried beans for bulking up winter soups and stews 😋
#broadbeans #favabeans #multipurpose #selfsufficiency #homegrown #homesteading
#organic #growwhatyoueat #greenmanure #nitrogenfixer #smallscalefarming

node.text:
It's time to pig out! 🐷 How great is this video that @4_kids_and_a_farm sent of their Berkshires enjoying our organic, non-GMO pellets?!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
What's not to love about Modesto Milling? All of our feeds are formulated with quality ingredients for a balanced feeding regimen. Find the perfect feed for your barnyard friend at the link in our profile!

Don't want to spend money on trays? Then grab your egg-cartons and turn them into your own Compostable Microgreen trays! 🌱👩‍🌾👨‍🌾
•
🥳We loved how easy it was to use our egg cartons and give them a new purpose instead of just tossing them out. They worked PERFECTLY to grow lush trays of Radish & Broccoli for us in our Kitchen!
•
✅Hope y'all enjoy this new video!! We're back from our anniversary trip and it was incredible 😁
•
🔥To watch our new YT video swipe up in our IG story or check out this link ➡️ https://youtu.be/-lazaDHaqMU
.
.

node.text:
Blueberries Blushing 💜💙

I have had this plant in the ground for 2 years and it finally looks like I’m going to get my first harvest😍. This was a little experiment but I am now thinking of expanding my collection and growing a few more in containers. Would love some recommendations on the best varieties to grow, please drop them below in the comments, it will really help out a novice blueberry grower😊
Enjoy the weekend in the garden, I’m off to check my tomatoes, wild windy weather is on the way.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Urban Food Garden in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. Image may contain: plant, flower, outdoor and nature.

node.text:
New video out today in my bio about making some super compost, utilizing forest microbes and Korean natural farming techniques. I go over a lot of different advanced concepts to help you make a more nutrient rich and microbial diverse compost. 
.
Also big in this pile is bokashi. I saved up 4 months of our kitchen waste which allowed me to not have to make a pile until right now. One of my favorite things about bokashi is it locks in the nutrients for use later and nothing goes to waste. @sdmicrobes has the best stuff on the market which you can now get on my website. 'nature77' for a 10% discount.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Steven Cornett on December 04, 2020. Image may contain: 1 person, drink and text.

node.text:
Ramiro Silva has grown strawberries in central Mexico for over 20 years. But despite his many years of experience, he often struggled to control plant diseases and pests around the farm. He also sold through intermediaries, earning limited money from his crops. After joining a TechnoServe program, Ramiro gained the skills and connections he needed to improve his production and increase his income.⠀
Visit the link in our bio to learn more.⠀
.⠀
.⠀
.⠀
.⠀
.⠀
#InvestingInPeople #FarmingCommunity #FightingPoverty #MakingADifference #Agriculture #AgriBusiness #SustainableAgriculture #LifeOfAFarmer #SustainabilityMatters #SmallScaleFarming #GreenGrowth

node.text:
A lot of the new photos on my page will be coming from my second greenhouse soon! Here I am harvesting salad mix in Greenhouse 1. Greenhouse 2 is producing microgreens right now and I’m still planting seedlings, theres hundreds and hundreds that need to go in! With the 2nd greenhouse up and running I’ll be collecting wholesale accounts for the microgreens. I can grow 200 trays a week in the 2nd greenhouse and still grow salad mix, kale and other great crops alongside it. I have a few accounts lined up already but if you are looking for microgreens for wholesale feel free to holla at me 💁🏽‍♀️ 🌈
—————
I’ll also be selling seedlings in the spring. I’m starting up my seedling production for perennial herbs right now! I’ll be selling seedlings April + May ☀️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by AsianAtlantis on December 04, 2020. Image may contain: plant and food.

node.text:
It’s December and the #covercrops and are still thriving!
•
When we say cover crops hold on to the soil through the winter, this is what we’re talking about. If not for these plants, this ground would be bare and that soil would not be benefiting from all that these roots provide—food, shelter, and nitrogen. 
•
You see those little bumps on that pea root? Those are pockets filled with bacteria that are taking nitrogen out of the air and putting it into a form that plants can use next year. Pretty neat!
•
•
#smallfarms #organicfarming #smallscalefarming #organicfarmers #iowafarm #thisisiowa #growjc2020 #goodfoodforall #goodfoodisahumanright #iowaoutdoors #iowacity #iowafarmers #thinkiowacity #sustainableagriculture

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 21 Acres on December 04, 2020.

node.text:
🤔 Because in the conventional system, it works like this: 

▪ There is no stable income for the coffee farmers. 
▪ Most of the value generated in the supply chain is kept in the consuming countries, enhancing social inequalities.
▪ The whole business is oriented by profit, exploiting the environment and the people who work on it. 

So here is the alternative we propose: 
▫ A monthly and stable income for coffee farmers. 
▫ A trust-building chain. 
▫ A sustainability-oriented system.

🌱We started this with the Giraldo family and we are making it happen. 
That makes us feel proud. It is great to share it with you. ☕💛

𝗩𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘁 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝗽 👉🏽 𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸 𝗶𝗻 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗕𝗶𝗼 ☕⠀
https://hilo.cafe/hilo-shop/
___⠀
🇩🇪⠀

🤔 Im herkömmlichen System funktionierte es so:
▪ Für die Kaffeebauern gibt es kein stabiles Einkommen.
▪ Der größte Teil der Gewinne das die Lieferkette generiert fließt in die Konsumländer, was die sozialen Ungleichheiten verschlimmert.
▪ Das gesamte Unternehmen ist Geld orientiert und missbraucht die Umwelt und die Menschen, die daran arbeiten.

Hier ist unsere Alternative:
▫ Ein monatliches und stabiles Einkommen
▫ Eine vertrauensbildende Kette.
▫ Eine nachhaltigkeit orientiertes System.

🌱Wir haben das mit der Giraldo Familie angefangen, und wir sind noch nicht fertig. Darauf sind wir stolz, und wir freuen uns es mit euch zu teilen.☕💛

𝗕𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗰𝗵𝗲 𝘂𝗻𝘀𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗽 👉🏽 𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸 𝗶𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗻 𝘂𝗻𝘀𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗿 𝗕𝗶𝗼 ☕⠀
https://hilo.cafe/hilo-shop/
⠀
⠀

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Sammamish Valley Alliance in Woodinville, Washington. Image may contain: food.

node.text:
MASKS VS LOCAL FOOD? Never thought we'd have to ask that question. 

“I’m sorry ma’am, all of our suppliers are out of row cover. The manufacturers have switched to making face masks”. 

My mouth dropped open. The idea of farming in a northern climate without row cover could not be more daunting. How would we get early enough plantings? How would we make a profit? Will we have to bootstrap some row cover out of old bed sheets? Will we have to put up 5 more greenhouses to protect our vegetable crops (no way that's in the budget)?

As row cover manufacturers switch to making disposable masks, small farms may face a shortage of this crucial tool for growing local organic produce. 

Meanwhile, the mask industry as well as global food conglomerates profit in the billions, posing the question: are masks and corporations more important than local food and small farms?

Read the full article at LINK IN BIO!

#smallfarms #organicfarming #rowcover #shortage #maskmania #localfood #healthiswealth #eatorganic #localfarms #smallscalefarming

node.text: I’m so pleased with my winter plants, I picked spinach and kale last night for an egg bake—#breakfastfordinner, and then ironically had the leftovers for breakfast. I did throw some extra kale and spinach seeds down during a warm spell last week but I’m guessing those won’t germinate now with a hard frost—maybe they’ll peek up in the spring. I can’t remember what this purple flowering plant was called, but the pollinators loved it in the summer and it’s still beautiful now in December. #wintergarden #kitchengarden #raisedbedgardening #gardening #farmette #homestead #hobbyfarm #coldweathercrops #potager #allotment #garden #farmhousegarden #smallacreage #smallscalefarming

node.text:
How cute is this darling Indian Runner? 🦆 If you’ve been contemplating adding ducks to your homestead for a while, @the_frenchiefarm says “DO IT NOW!”

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @the_frenchiefarm

“Frenchie Farm is an organic and regenerative family farm raising Nigerian Dwarf goats, Great Pyrenees, and pasture raised chickens, ducks, and broiler chickens. We provide farm classes for kids dedicated to teaching children about sustainable farming. Frenchie Farm also sells seasonally appropriate farm-to-table goods, including but not limited to, pasture raised chicken + duck eggs, pasture raised broiler chickens, honey, and seasonal produce.”

In an effort to live a more simplified life with intention and gratitude, our family made the decision to pursue modern homesteading. We grow as much of our own food as possible in our garden while also raising Nigerian Dwarf goats, chickens, and bees.”

Chicago, Illinois
📸: @the_frenchiefarm
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Join the movement! 👩‍🌾 👍 Let’s Revive Small Local Farms 🙌🏻 We feature small regenerative growers 👩‍🌾 👨‍🌾 from around the world! 🥕
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Support Us by checkin’ out our SMALL-SCALE FARMING APPAREL! 🤩💚 Link in bio --> @farmstandrevival *1 % Of Profits Donated Tp Supporting Small Farms!

node.text:
“On the first day of Christmas, my true love gave to me, one jar of prickly pear jellyyyyyyy!”

Maybe that’s stretching it a bit, but prickly pear jelly could be that small, unique gift you’re wanting for that teacher, co-worker, etc. We’ll have some available tomorrow at the @wacofarmersmkt along with our normal chicken, broth and egg selections. Order online by 6pm tonight, and you can pick it up at the market tomorrow. (Follow the link in our profile and hit the shop button to order online). Happy Friday!

#uniquegifts #wacofarmersmarket #wacofarmersmkt #buylocal #shoplocal #eatlocalfood #lovemymarket #wacoweekend #orderonline #localfarm #centraltexasfarm #smallfarm #farm #smallscalefarming #smallbusiness #texasgrown #texas #valleymillstx #cayotetx #waco #wacotexas #knowyourfarmer #knowyourfarmerknowyourfood #farmfresh #bonebroth #pricklypearjelly #pasturedchicken #pasturedeggs

node.text:
SA Canegrowers fully supports the recent decision taken at a meeting of the South African Sugar Association (SASA) Council to allocate R43 million towards top-up payments for black small-scale growers for the remainder of the 2020/2021 season, over and above R157 million that has already been disbursed during the current financial year. This is to assist small-scale growers who have been hard hit by the Covid-19 pandemic and the national lockdown over the past few months. Link in bio.
.
.
.
#sugarcane #sugarcanefields #farming #farmlife #smallscalefarming #southafrica #agriculture #agri #innovation #farminginnovation #unitedinfarming #supportingfarmers #smallscalefarming #smallscalegrowers #sacanegrowers #sacanegrowersassociation #southafricaagriculture #southafricanfarming #agriculturesa #agriculturesouthafrica #southafricanfarmers #southafricanfarmer #agripreneur #organisedagri #organisedagriculture #farmtalk🚜 #farmforum #agriculture #farmers4thefuture

node.text:
A little thank you coming to all our CSA members with their next, and final CSA delivery for the round, thanks all for your support (can you guess what these little beauties are?).
.
Starting and joining the CSA has been a massive leap of faith for all of us, and we can't express just how important each and everyone one of you has been, and the enjoyment we get feeding you all! ❤❤❤
.
Looking forward to kicking off our next CSA in the new year!
.
#bellasatofarm #knowyourfarmer #pastureraised #buylocal #CSAFORTHEWIN #hinchinbrookway #sommerladchicken #localfood #smallscalefarming

node.text:
Last chance to grab the limited tickets remaining for our celebration of World Soil Day tomorrow with the #YFCNorthernRivers crew in Byron Bay at @hungry_earth_agroecology 

Don't miss out on this opportunity to explore a wonderful example and synergy of Permaculture, production systems, agroforestry and community building 

Come meet the farmers that make it happen.

www.youngfarmersconnect.com/events for tickets or via the FB group www.facebook.com/groups/YFCNorthernRivers

How the day will run:

10:00am – Welcome & Introductions

10:15am – Darren Robertson : @threeblueducks

– Andrew Cameron : @byronshirecouncil Agricultural Extension Officer

10:30am - Amanda Musgrave : @nsw_dpi Wollongbar Environmental Laboratory

11:00am – Katrina McDougall : @rfcsnorthernregion 

11:30am – James Geary  North Coast Local Land Services Agronomist

11: 45am - Farm Walk / Tour with Hungry Earth Agroecology

12:45pm – Lunch and social

All welcome – Tickets essential

#youngfarmersconnect #worldsoilday #agroecology #ecologicalfarming #soilhealth #soiltesting #saveoursoil #smallscalefarming #farmingtogether #communityfarm #marketgarden #byronbay #newfarmers #localfood #knowyourfarmer

node.text: I've been learning to grow my own edible mushrooms recently so I was stoked to see my friend Michael Kilpatrick @growingfarmers hosting this FREE educational summit with 27 high level experts. It takes place December 4-6th you can sign up through the first link in my bio. Can't wait to learn with y'all!

node.text:
We're super excited to share that we met our Giving Tuesday goal and then some: $24,499.15! Thank you, all!

Including the $20,000 match from a private donor, that’s $44,499.15 to support family farmers in Bolivia. It's been an incredibly challenging year—and it's certainly not over. But these funds will go a long way to easing some of the strain of the pandemic on farmers and their communities.

On behalf of everyone at SeedChange, thank you for your donations, likes, shares and encouragement! We could not have done it with you all. #ThankfulThursday

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by SeedChange / Sème l’avenir in SeedChange / Sème l’avenir - USC Canada with @martinsettle, @kc_killah, @jane_rabinowicz, @elodiemantha, @kategreen6767, and @rouelodie. Image may contain: 9 people, text.

node.text:
Home. Always staggered by this shot, by how fortunate we are to live in this corner of the world.
Along the bottom you can see the driveway winding through the top paddocks, the main dam, the orchards, the garden by the creek.
Cape Naturaliste is off in the distance, the southern ocean to its left and Geographe Bay to the right. You can even see Sugarloaf Rock. 

What do you see??
If you’re out there somewhere, tag or comment 👇🏼

Thank you @timcampbellphoto for the perspective 🦅

node.text:
Freshly harvested baby lettuces and giant green onions 👉🏼 unimaginably tasty salad 🥗

They all appeared in our garden spontaneously. Some onions were never harvested last season and lettuces that were left to flower and set seed created a shiny green lettuce carpet. A glimpse of permaculture? 🤔😛

node.text:
Here’s some vegetable gardening inspiration I came across recently during some research this week.  Take some time to check out the labeled image in slide 2 as well.  There is a lot going on here!  Do any of you do renderings like this for your vegetable garden at home?
 
The main house on the property is called Crawfordsburn House and the original structure dates back to 1820.  The site is located in Helen’s Bay, Northern Ireland.  Unfortunately, any records I found of the site skipped over most of the garden details, but if you’re keen to learn about the lineage of the site’s owners, here’s a link for you:  https://lordbelmontinnorthernireland.blogspot.com/2014/03/crawfordsburn-park.html
 
Credit goes to the Northern Ireland Environment Agency for preserving these artist renderings but no artist was recorded.

node.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, meet Elvis.. Super stoked to be adding this guy into the mix! “Mini” #americanspotted #donkey #livestockguardian #nigeriandwarfgoats #moonspots #smallscalefarming #hobbyfarm  #supportlocalfarmers #culpeper / #madisonva

Winter is here! The leaves have fallen and we had our first cold snap here in the SE. These leaves are from a gorgeous Japanese maple on our property. I just love living in a place that has seasons now, the beauty is incredible. Not to mention having unlimited carbon and leaf mold soil to inoculate my garden with! Here's to a winter of prepping hard for the coming season and whatever else our psychopathic "Rulers" have planned for us. Grow food and build community with other liberty lovers!

node.text:
A winter vegetable basket is anything but boring. 

Asian Atlantis Agriculture @asianatlantis, in Flores Island, Açores offers these at €30 per week. 

Fresh, organic, locally grown nutritious foods. Who could ask for more?

Pictured are French yellow carrots, Daikon radish, Bishops Crown peppers, Osaka mustard, yellow Swiss chard, purple pack choice, Mizuna greens, Fringe leaf purple mustard, onion greens, Chinese broccoli, celery, Serrano peppers. These are perfect for stir fry, sautée, and soup.

node.text:
We thinned out a few bunches of the red torpedo onions we direct sowed over winter and they are tasty.
Use them as spring onions young like these, fresh salad onions a little bigger or dried storage onions.
A popular and versatile crop for a small scale farmers we’d say
👨🏻‍🌾🌱👩🏼‍🌾
.
.
.

node.text:
How come Plant foods are just SO BEAUTIFUL?! I just adore them. 100% want to bring those into my body and let them become me ;)
(ok that sounded a little weird but you know what i mean ..!) 😆
.
Gorge produce this week from @nourishedcommunities – who, if you are local to #Islington, #London you’re lucky – these lovely peeps’ well-stocked popup shop open days are steadily increasing (think farm #marketstall + whole food shop + #zerowasteshop combined!)
.
I just love seeing small, passionate initiatives like these take foot and steadily grow stronger as people around them understand just how lucky they are to get access to this kind of produce. And just how much small businesses like these bring to a local area 👊 #shoplocalforthewin #londonlockdown2
.
Much love, Sara x
#shisodelicious

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 🍇Garden Community🍇 on November 26, 2020. Image may contain: outdoor.

node.text: We have been so busy getting the farm ready for winter but I’m happy to say we got the new greenhouse up and running right before the first snowfall of the season. It’s not perfect but I’m proud of how it came out and happy to have more space for our #microgreens 🌱Building a greenhouse from scratch was the easy part, growing in Tahoe during the winter will be the challenging part. 🌱🌱🌱 #HighAltitudeFarming
